com.poesys.accounting.dataloader.newaccounting

Class Transaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.accounting.dataloader.newaccounting.Transaction

  • public class Transaction
extends java.lang.Object
    A data transfer object containing data about transaction (a set of items that represent a balanced exchange of money between accounts on a certain date); the transaction contains a single balance item (a "balance" transaction, which happens at the beginning of the set of transactions to initialize the balance sheet accounts) or a set of items that balance to zero; the transaction may or may not have been officially reconciled against an external data source
    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Constructor Detail

      • Transaction

        public Transaction(java.math.BigInteger id,
                   java.lang.String description,
                   java.sql.Timestamp date,
                   java.lang.Boolean checked,
                   java.lang.Boolean balance)
        Create a Transaction object.
        Parameters:
        id - unique id from old accounting system (required, used as key)
        description - text describing the nature of the transaction, including ids
        date - date and time at which the transaction occurred (required)
        checked - whether the transaction amounts have been fully reconciled
        balance - whether the transaction is a balance transaction

      • isChecked

        public java.lang.Boolean isChecked()
        Has the transaction been reconciled against an external data source? If so, all items should have been checked. If they aren't, the method returns false, ignoring the input checked=true data.
        Returns:
        true if reconciled, false if not reconciled

      • isBalance

        public java.lang.Boolean isBalance()
        Is this a balance transaction? If true, then there must be a single item; if false, the items must sum to zero, treating debits as negative and credits as positive numbers.
        Returns:
        true for balance transaction, false for regular transaction

      • isValid

        public java.lang.Boolean isValid()
        Is the transaction valid? To be valid, a transaction must have balanced transaction items (debits and credits sum to zero) or must be a balance transaction with a single item.
        Returns:
        true if valid, false if invalid

      • isBalanced

        private java.lang.Boolean isBalanced()
        Is the set of items balanced--does the sum of the credits and debits equal zero with debits taken as negative numbers?
        Returns:
        true if balanced, false if not

      • getItem

        public Item getItem(Account account)
        Get the item in the transaction that is against the specified account.
        Parameters:
        account - the account to look up
        Returns:
        the item against the account or null if there is no item against that account

      • getItems

        public java.util.Set<Item> getItems()
        Get the threadsafe set of items.
        Returns:
        a set of items

      • addItem

        public Item addItem(java.lang.Double amount,
                    Account account,
                    java.lang.Boolean debit,
                    java.lang.Boolean checked)
        Add a regular item to the set of items with the specified elements.
        Parameters:
        amount - the dollar amount of the item (non-negative double)
        account - the account against which the item applies
        debit - whether the item is a debit or credit
        checked - whether the system has reconciled the item against an external data source
        Returns:
        the created item
